definition:
The Class of events in which a cell 
is penetrated by a virus and in which a virus enters the cell to be, or 
perhaps not be, further processed within the cell.
opposite_reasoning: ViralCellExit represents the strongest semantic opposition as the complementary process in the viral lifecycle - the directional inverse of invasion. While it may not exist in current ontologies, it provides the clearest conceptual anchor for Fisher-LDA: invasion (penetration inward) vs exit (release outward). This captures the essential directional and temporal opposition. If unavailable, CellularDefense is the best fallback as it represents the functional antagonist to viral invasion and likely exists in SUMO's biological process hierarchy.
